channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Deep-Based Approach for Multi-Descriptor Feature Extraction: Applications on SAR Image Registration
item.description: To address the challenges of SAR images, we utilize the R2D2 network and propose a training scheme specifically tailored for these images.

item.title: FPPL: An Efficient and Non-IID Robust Federated Continual Learning Framework
item.description: In this work, an efficient and non-IID robust federated continual learning framework, called Federated Prototype-Augmented Prompt Learning (FPPL), is proposed.

item.title: Targeted Manipulation and Deception Emerge when Optimizing LLMs for User Feedback
item.description: As LLMs become more widely deployed, there is increasing interest in directly optimizing for feedback from end users (e. g. thumbs up) in addition to feedback from paid annotators.

item.title: Collaborative Cognitive Diagnosis with Disentangled Representation Learning for Learner Modeling
item.description: Motivated by the success of collaborative modeling in various domains, such as recommender systems, we aim to investigate how collaborative signals among learners contribute to the diagnosis of human cognitive states (i. e., knowledge proficiency) in the context of intelligent education.

item.title: Unified Speech Recognition: A Single Model for Auditory, Visual, and Audiovisual Inputs
item.description: We demonstrate that training a single model for all three tasks enhances VSR and AVSR performance, overcoming typical optimisation challenges when training from scratch.

item.title: Exploring the Landscape for Generative Sequence Models for Specialized Data Synthesis
item.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) research often aims to develop models that generalize reliably across complex datasets, yet this remains challenging in fields where data is scarce, intricate, or inaccessible.

item.title: Masked Autoencoders are Parameter-Efficient Federated Continual Learners
item.description: Although advanced prompt-based continual learning methods leverage pre-trained transformers to mitigate catastrophic forgetting, they do not adequately address the non-IID challenges in federated learning.

item.title: Breaking the Reclustering Barrier in Centroid-based Deep Clustering
item.description: This work investigates an important phenomenon in centroid-based deep clustering (DC) algorithms: Performance quickly saturates after a period of rapid early gains.

item.title: Understanding Variational Autoencoders with Intrinsic Dimension and Information Imbalance
item.description: This work presents an analysis of the hidden representations of Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) using the Intrinsic Dimension (ID) and the Information Imbalance (II).

item.title: Multi-task Geometric Estimation of Depth and Surface Normal from Monocular 360Â° Images
item.description: Our first innovation is our MTL architecture, which enhances predictions for both tasks by integrating geometric information from depth and surface normal estimation, enabling a deeper understanding of 3D scene structure.

item.title: A Probabilistic Formulation of LiDAR Mapping with Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: In this paper we reexamine the process through which a Neural Radiance Field (NeRF) can be trained to produce novel LiDAR views of a scene.

item.title: Typicalness-Aware Learning for Failure Detection
item.description: We observe that, with the cross-entropy loss, model predictions are optimized to align with the corresponding labels via increasing logit magnitude or refining logit direction.

item.title: Constrained Human-AI Cooperation: An Inclusive Embodied Social Intelligence Challenge
item.description: In CHAIC, the goal is for an embodied agent equipped with egocentric observations to assist a human who may be operating under physical constraints -- e. g., unable to reach high places or confined to a wheelchair -- in performing common household or outdoor tasks as efficiently as possible.

item.title: OwMatch: Conditional Self-Labeling with Consistency for Open-World Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: However, the emergence of open-world SSL (OwSSL) introduces a more practical challenge, wherein unlabeled data may encompass samples from unseen classes.

item.title: UnSegMedGAT: Unsupervised Medical Image Segmentation using Graph Attention Networks Clustering
item.description: The data-intensive nature of supervised classification drives the interest of the researchers towards unsupervised approaches, especially for problems such as medical image segmentation, where labeled data is scarce.

item.title: RAGViz: Diagnose and Visualize Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: With a built-in user interface, retrieval index, and Large Language Model (LLM) backbone, RAGViz provides two main functionalities: (1) token and document-level attention visualization, and (2) generation comparison upon context document addition and removal.

item.title: DeeR-VLA: Dynamic Inference of Multimodal Large Language Models for Efficient Robot Execution
item.description: MLLMs have demonstrated remarkable comprehension and reasoning capabilities with complex language and visual data.

item.title: Adaptive Length Image Tokenization via Recurrent Allocation
item.description: Our encoder-decoder architecture recursively processes 2D image tokens, distilling them into 1D latent tokens over multiple iterations of recurrent rollouts.

item.title: Exploiting Unlabeled Data with Multiple Expert Teachers for Open Vocabulary Aerial Object Detection and Its Orientation Adaptation
item.description: In this paper, we put forth a novel formulation of the aerial object detection problem, namely open-vocabulary aerial object detection (OVAD), which can detect objects beyond training categories without costly collecting new labeled data.

item.title: Generating the Traces You Need: A Conditional Generative Model for Process Mining Data
item.description: In this work, we address this challenge by introducing a conditional model for process data generation based on a conditional variational autoencoder (CVAE).

item.title: HACD: Harnessing Attribute Semantics and Mesoscopic Structure for Community Detection
item.description: While previous research has effectively leveraged network topology and attribute information for attributed community detection, these methods overlook two critical issues: (i) the semantic similarity between node attributes within the community, and (ii) the inherent mesoscopic structure, which differs from the pairwise connections of the micro-structure.

item.title: MeToken: Uniform Micro-environment Token Boosts Post-Translational Modification Prediction
item.description: Post-translational modifications (PTMs) profoundly expand the complexity and functionality of the proteome, regulating protein attributes and interactions that are crucial for biological processes.

item.title: Training-free Regional Prompting for Diffusion Transformers
item.description: Diffusion models have demonstrated excellent capabilities in text-to-image generation.

item.title: MBDRes-U-Net: Multi-Scale Lightweight Brain Tumor Segmentation Network
item.description: Accurate segmentation of brain tumors plays a key role in the diagnosis and treatment of brain tumor diseases.

item.title: Simulation of Nanorobots with Artificial Intelligence and Reinforcement Learning for Advanced Cancer Cell Detection and Tracking
item.description: Nanorobots are a promising development in targeted drug delivery and the treatment of neurological disorders, with potential for crossing the blood-brain barrier (BBB).

item.title: Thinking Forward and Backward: Effective Backward Planning with Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have exhibited remarkable reasoning and planning capabilities.

item.title: Evaluating Creative Short Story Generation in Humans and Large Language Models
item.description: Storytelling is a fundamental aspect of human communication, relying heavily on creativity to produce narratives that are novel, appropriate, and surprising.

item.title: Learning Where to Edit Vision Transformers
item.description: Model editing aims to data-efficiently correct predictive errors of large pre-trained models while ensuring generalization to neighboring failures and locality to minimize unintended effects on unrelated examples.

item.title: CRMArena: Understanding the Capacity of LLM Agents to Perform Professional CRM Tasks in Realistic Environments
item.description: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems are vital for modern enterprises, providing a foundation for managing customer interactions and data.

item.title: Bridge-IF: Learning Inverse Protein Folding with Markov Bridges
item.description: To fill these gaps, we propose Bridge-IF, a generative diffusion bridge model for inverse folding, which is designed to learn the probabilistic dependency between the distributions of backbone structures and protein sequences.

item.title: xDiT: an Inference Engine for Diffusion Transformers (DiTs) with Massive Parallelism
item.description: Parallel inference is essential for real-time DiTs deployments, but relying on a single parallel method is impractical due to poor scalability at large scales.

item.title: Addressing Representation Collapse in Vector Quantized Models with One Linear Layer
item.description: However, VQ models are often hindered by the problem of representation collapse in the latent space, which leads to low codebook utilization and limits the scalability of the codebook for large-scale training.

item.title: LiDAttack: Robust Black-box Attack on LiDAR-based Object Detection
item.description: Since DNN is vulnerable to carefully crafted adversarial examples, adversarial attack on LiDAR sensors have been extensively studied.

item.title: Training Compute-Optimal Protein Language Models
item.description: We explore optimally training protein language models, an area of significant interest in biological research where guidance on best practices is limited.

item.title: Revisiting K-mer Profile for Effective and Scalable Genome Representation Learning
item.description: We compare the model to recent genome foundation models and demonstrate that while the models are comparable in performance, the proposed model is significantly more effective in terms of scalability, a crucial aspect for performing metagenomic binning of real-world datasets.

item.title: PPLLaVA: Varied Video Sequence Understanding With Prompt Guidance
item.description: In this paper, we identify the key issue as the redundant content in videos.

item.title: Hunyuan-Large: An Open-Source MoE Model with 52 Billion Activated Parameters by Tencent
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Hunyuan-Large, which is currently the largest open-source Transformer-based mixture of experts model, with a total of 389 billion parameters and 52 billion activation parameters, capable of handling up to 256K tokens.

item.title: LayerDAG: A Layerwise Autoregressive Diffusion Model for Directed Acyclic Graph Generation
item.description: By interpreting the partial order of nodes as a sequence of bipartite graphs, LayerDAG leverages autoregressive generation to model directional dependencies and employs diffusion models to capture logical dependencies within each bipartite graph.

item.title: Improving Trust Estimation in Human-Robot Collaboration Using Beta Reputation at Fine-grained Timescales
item.description: Additionally, manually crafting a reward function is the usual method of building a performance indicator, which is labor-intensive and time-consuming.

item.title: Learning General-Purpose Biomedical Volume Representations using Randomized Synthesis
item.description: Current volumetric biomedical foundation models struggle to generalize as public 3D datasets are small and do not cover the broad diversity of medical procedures, conditions, anatomical regions, and imaging protocols.

item.title: Expanding Sparse Tuning for Low Memory Usage
item.description: In this paper, we propose a method named SNELL (Sparse tuning with kerNELized LoRA) for sparse tuning with low memory usage.

item.title: Improving Steering Vectors by Targeting Sparse Autoencoder Features
item.description: To control the behavior of language models, steering methods attempt to ensure that outputs of the model satisfy specific pre-defined properties.

item.title: Alignment-Based Adversarial Training (ABAT) for Improving the Robustness and Accuracy of EEG-Based BCIs
item.description: Data alignment aligns EEG trials from different domains to reduce their distribution discrepancies, and adversarial training further robustifies the classification boundary.

item.title: Diagnosing Medical Datasets with Training Dynamics
item.description: The framework used is Data Maps, which classifies data points into categories such as easy-to-learn, hard-to-learn, and ambiguous (Swayamdipta et al., 2020).

item.title: FilterNet: Harnessing Frequency Filters for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: While numerous forecasters have been proposed using different network architectures, the Transformer-based models have state-of-the-art performance in time series forecasting.

item.title: Classifier-guided Gradient Modulation for Enhanced Multimodal Learning
item.description: Existing methods to balance the training process always have some limitations on the loss functions, optimizers and the number of modalities and only consider modulating the magnitude of the gradients while ignoring the directions of the gradients.

item.title: FactorizePhys: Matrix Factorization for Multidimensional Attention in Remote Physiological Sensing
item.description: To demonstrate FSAM's effectiveness, we developed FactorizePhys, an end-to-end 3D-CNN architecture for estimating blood volume pulse signals from raw video frames.

item.title: MoCE: Adaptive Mixture of Contextualization Experts for Byte-based Neural Machine Translation
item.description: Byte-based machine translation systems have shown significant potential in massively multilingual settings.

item.title: Rethinking Weight Decay for Robust Fine-Tuning of Foundation Models
item.description: This exploration is beneficial for finding good loss basins when training from scratch.

item.title: Large-Scale Multi-Robot Coverage Path Planning on Grids with Path Deconfliction
item.description: We study Multi-Robot Coverage Path Planning (MCPP) on a 4-neighbor 2D grid G, which aims to compute paths for multiple robots to cover all cells of G. Traditional approaches are limited as they first compute coverage trees on a quadrant coarsened grid H and then employ the Spanning Tree Coverage (STC) paradigm to generate paths on G, making them inapplicable to grids with partially obstructed 2x2 blocks.
